      • sendAudioFile

        public final Message sendAudioFile(AudioFileToSend afs)
        Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .ogg file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
        Parameters:
        afs -
        Returns:

      • sendDocumentFile

        public Message sendDocumentFile(DocumentFileToSend dfs)
        Use this method to send general files. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send files of any type of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
        Parameters:
        dfs -
        Returns:

      • sendVideoFile

        public final Message sendVideoFile(VideoFileToSend vfs)
        Use this method to send video files, Telegram clients support mp4 videos (other formats may be sent as Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send video files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
        Parameters:
        vfs -
        Returns:

        Parameters:
        lts -
        Returns:

      • sendChatAction

        public final void sendChatAction(ChatActionToSend cts)
        Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status). Example: The ImageBot needs some time to process a request and upload the image. Instead of sending a text message along the lines of “Retrieving image, please wait…”, the bot may use sendChatAction with action = upload_photo. The user will see a “sending photo” status for the bot.
        Parameters:
        cts -

      • getUserProfilePhotos

        public final UserProfilePhotos getUserProfilePhotos(UserProfilePhotosRequest upr)
        Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a UserProfilePhotos object.
        Parameters:
        upr -
        Returns:
